overview: Dr. Steve Chaohuang Zeng was a co-founder and VP of system design at Amicus Wireless Technology Inc., which is a leader in the mobile WIMAX terminal chipset and backed by venture investments of more than $20 Million. He worked at Atheros (NASDAQ:? ATHR) as a key system architect on Atheros’ wireless LAN chipsets that are sold over 100 million units. While in Stanford, Steve was the pioneer on dynamic spectrum management for DSL systems. Steve received the IEEE outstanding contribution award in 2006. Steve holds a Ph.D. and a Master degree of Electrical Engineering from Stanford University and a Bachelor of Science degree from Tsinghua University, PR China. 6 US patents have been granted to Steve and 12 more patents are pending.
